short_summary: Procurement of various marine hardware items for the Canadian Armed Forces
full_summary:
# Victoria Class Spares Tender

## Tender Details
**Tender Title:** 
Multiple Victoria Class Spares - Valve, Washer, Cable Assembly, Cowl Diesel Exhaust, Adapter, and Seal Plain

**Reference Number:** PW-22-01006081

**Solicitation Number:** W8482-230650/A

**Publication Date:** September 6, 2022

**Tender Closing Date:** October 19, 2022, 14:00 (ET)

## Trade Agreements
The tender is open to suppliers who are signatories to the following trade agreements:

* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

## Soliciting Party
The tender is issued by the Department of National Defence.

## Project Overview
The Department of National Defence is seeking proposals for the delivery of multiple Victoria-class spares, consisting of:

1. Ball valves
2. Recessed washers
3. Electrical cable assemblies
4. Diesel exhaust cowl parts
5. Adapters
6. Plain seals

The delivery locations are specified as CFB Esquimalt and CFB Halifax.

## Tender Documents
The tender documents, including the request for proposal and annexes, are available for download at [canadabuys.canada.ca](https://canadabuys.canada.ca).

**Attachments:**

* Amendment 1 to the Request for Proposal (English only)
* Annex A (English only)
* Request for Proposal (English and French)

## Important References
Submitters proposing an equivalent or substitute product must indicate the brand name, model, and/or part number and NCAGE.

It is essential to review the tender documents and contract requirements before submitting a proposal.

Canada uses a bilingual communication approach as per the Official Languages Act. Documents may be presented in either official language of Canada. 

This is a professional translation of the contractor shared with you.
I left some of the original details, while you can edit or remove them if you
